utterances.sentences: So, these are bath salts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: These are, you know, these are illegal smelling salts. utterances.speaker: PIRRO

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Why don't they sell them anymore?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Something -- I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Or something. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The old met thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.sentences: I get the point. Now this is great.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's good. I am adding a mouth guard because it might be the only thing left after 2020. You know, it's going to be a fight.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Gosh. So, you're not going to put that in there now?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You just contaminated the capsule, Greg. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And it taste funny.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: let's wash it before we put --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When I played pop warner football or whatever. But yes, this is - -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Danny, come get it and clean it. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No. We'll need a new one. This one will be used for some kind of criminal investigation.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Where is this going to be until next year?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Where are we going to put the time capsule?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What? Good question?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Where is that going to be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So, we're going to put it in a place where no one ever goes to. The Fox News gym. I kid. But it will be played in a locker at the Fox News gym --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- with its own --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Personal trainer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Personal trainer. And then we'll open it. Now the question is, do we open it? My God. The night of the -- do we wait Tuesday or do we wait until Wednesday?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think after. Yes, Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. That's what we will do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That will be -- I mean, everyone set their DVRs a year from now.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So, we all have to be on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, we all have to be on. That will be funny thing like if some of us aren't here anymore.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Do we want to take (Inaudible) not any place and he bets on who might not be here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But did you put the mouth guard in? Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I didn't put the mouth guard in, you're telling me not to because you want put in a new one because I put it in my mouth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Put it in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Groovy. Well, that was fun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There we go.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: yes, but I need my gavel for my office.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You are not getting the gavel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You'll get it in a year.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We'll get you another gavel.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes? Like that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's leucite, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can't get a leucite gavel just anywhere.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We'll get her a wooden one.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I had one and I broke it when I was on the bench.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that right? You just whacked it. You get it broken on some guy's head.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They were too far from me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. I guess, am I teasing now? Up next, nine Americans including women and children were gunned down by a drug cartel in Mexico. The latest ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Now a disturbing story that we've been following. A massacre south of the border. At least nine Americans are dead including six children. The family was travelling in three separate SUVs when they were brutally ambushed by a drug cartel gunman. One family member sharing this gut-wrenching video of a burnt-out car where some of the victims were discovered.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: This is for the record. Nita and four of my grandchildren are burned and shot up.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's still not clear what exactly happened. The FBI is investigating and Mexican authorities say the family may have been mistaken for a rival gang. The president, however, demanding action, tweeting, "This is the time for Mexico with the help of the United States to wage war on the drug cartels and wipe them off the face of the earth. We merely await a call from your great new president." Jesse, you know, it seems to me, we are still trying to get our minds around this, it's a terrible tragedy. Children dying, mothers dying.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But it's a manifestation of the kind of drug violence that we've seen, not only in Mexico. We've seen here in the United States, it's even worse in places like El Salvador, Colombia. And I suspect this is why people flee. What do you think is the appropriate response?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, people flee not just for drug violence but also to get money working in America. I think it's a dangerous country. And outside the resorts, I mean, this could happen anywhere. It's not a safe place to be. Our neighbors to the south are corrupt. The cartels run this government. El Chapo is worth a billion dollars before he got pinched. They tell the Mexican government officials what to do. Many of them are on the take. They can't control the cartels. Most of the times they don't want to. They're just dancing with the devils. It's kind of an arranged marriage. And this country loves our drugs and we like them cheap. So, we are fighting this war on drugs. It's the longest war America has ever fought. I don't see an end game. But right now, the cartels made a very, very big mistake. Because Donald Trump is going to want justice, he's going to want vengeance and he has been looking for an opportunity to squeeze the Mexican government on the border. It's good politics to go after the cartels, it's good policies to go after the cartels. And watch, he'll do that and you'll see the media and the Democrats start defending drug cartels. I guarantee it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow. I don't know about that one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No. You don't remember he said MS-13 are animals and Nancy defended them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: yes, it was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Judge, Mexico rejected the president's offer to send in some military-type help.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And the argument is well, you know, after the El Paso white supremacist shooting Mexico is saying we are going to send Mexican troops to El Paso. What do you think about the fact that they are saying no?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, I'm glad you brought it up. Because in response to what the president said it's time for Mexico with the help of the United States to go after these cartels and wage war. The new president of Mexico says, quote, "The worst thing you can have is war. We declared war and it didn't work. That is not an option." Well, if war against the cartel, a drug cartel that's killing women, children, babies, burning, shooting. Kidnapping them. It's not justified, then you know what. I don't know. Then the president, as far as I'm concerned has the right to do whatever it is he needs to do to go in there and protect American citizens who are there. Now there apparently is an area in that Sonora and Chihuahua area where Americans have bene living safely for many, many years. They are about 70 miles from the Arizona border. So, I suspect they feel a certain comfort level there. Although in researching the issue of the danger level, Mexico as a country is a level two danger zone.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Those particular counties, Sonora and Chihuahua are level three. Advanced warning because the Sinaloa cartel is doing business there. So, you got a combination of people having to worry about what is going on in their neighborhood and a combination of, you know, Americans saying it's not a safe place to be. So, what do you do? You go in there and you send in military as far as I'm concerned in a situation like that. If they are doing this to American citizens. It's not enough. Because if the president is saying we can't wage war, it's not an option, what does he want to do? Have diplomacy? Meet them at the table? These people will cut your - limbs off because this is how they make their money.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK. So, Dana, you know, I just want to express the hope that, you know, people don't, especially President Trump doesn't use this to exploit the tragedy to somehow attack Mexicans or for the wall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan -- Juan, Americans were just slaughtered, babies were burned alive --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I'm talking --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- and you are saying Trump is going to exploit it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. You just talked about the politics. In fact, you said you don't think that this is the war on drugs as really been a success --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, I think it's a little too soon for all of that right now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But I think the point -

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, my point to Dana was --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think anybody is exploiting anybody --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- except that the cartels are exploiting innocent people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is a big story because they are Americans and it's a big story here. But let's just -- let me mention to you. In 2018, homicides linked to drug cartels 36,000 people in 2018. In 2019, 90 murders a day. So not there is a question as to whether this was actually mistaken identity.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Our State Department through anonymous source basically said they don't think that's the case. And so, now Mexico has a war on its hands whether they like or not. The president of the United States is saying I will help you. And I don't think the Mexican government has enough confidence, as Jesse was saying, they're basically, you know, the slaves too, the cartel. I am a big proponent of solving problems at their source. The question is what is the source? Si it the supply or the demand? And do we do something on the demand side here? Like it's like legalization? I don't know. That's got to be determined by smarter people. But I also think there is one other policy recommendation that the president could do. And that is designating the cartels as a terrorist organization and then that changes everything legally --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: the banking.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- and what you can do. And basically you can then say you are either with us or you're against us and you have more tools to fight.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think they already go after the money for the drug cartels.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, they've tried.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But if you designate them as a terrorist organization.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'll be fast. To your point, this is how they make their money. They make their money because it's an illegal industry. I would rather end the drug war than fight a drug war because we haven't -- we can't win a war. So, ultimately, at some point, we're going to have to decriminalize drugs in the United States which will handle -- which will handle the demand question so that it doesn't end up on the streets. We know that there is a down side to that. You will see junkies as we have seen in our own neighborhoods.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's surrender.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's surrender.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hey, everybody has a right to their oblivion. And we know for one thing that people are still going to chase their right to oblivion no matter how dangerous or risky it is. You got to -- in order to change or cut throat business you got to turn it into a business.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow. That's really an interesting discussion. An ABC anchor admitting her network stopped a bombshell story about Jeffrey Epstein. We're going to show you the tape next right here on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: An ABC News anchor caught on a hot mic saying the network spiked an explosive story about Jeffrey Epstein three years ago. Project veritas has released the video. Now Fox News has not been able to independently verify it. But here it is.

utterances.speaker: AMY ROBACH, ANCHOR, ABC NEWS
utterances.sentences: I've had a story for three years. I've had this interview with Virginia Roberts. We would not put it on the air. First of all, I was told, who's Jeffrey Epstein? No one knows who that is. This is a stupid story. Then the Palace found out that we had her whole allegations about Prince Andrew and threatened us in a million different ways. We were so afraid we wouldn't be able to interview Kate and Will, that we -- that also squashed the story. She told me everything. She had pictures. She was in hiding for 12 years. We convinced her to come out. We convinced her to talk to us. It was unbelievable what we had Clinton. We had everything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That is something.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Amy Robach now claims she was caught in a moment of frustration and the interview wasn't ready for air. And ABC is downplaying video, saying, quote, "At the time, not all of our reporting met our standards to air, but we have never stop investigating the story." Dana? You're the real journalist here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, Amy Robach, a terrific reporter. She recently landed the Hunter Biden interview in which she put him through his paces there. When I first heard this, I thought, this can happen. Right. So we all have commercial breaks. Many a day.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And you think, somebody could actually take the video of what you are saying during commercial break which is like a commercial break chitchat and then -- and then leak it. I find the walk back a little hard to believe. And I think that the defense from ABC I think they got caught flat footed. I wouldn't be to be their P.R. department there today because a P.R. department isn't the one that made the call. It sounds like there's something happened. And again, it just adds to the additional mystery about what happened with Jeffrey Epstein. How people covered it up for years and now even in his death there are questions.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You know, the amazing thing about it, Greg, you had NBC who, you know, through Ronan Farrow said this thing is already there. Now we found out that ABC is doing the same kind of thing. And you know, she, her frustration is evidenced by the fact that she says we had everything. I tried for three years to get it on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: The woman was quiet. Virginia Roberts, Giuffre Roberts, whatever the name is, was quiet for 12 years. I get her to talk and they don't want to play it. What is ABC's connection?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It is amazing how many people Hillary Clinton can kill over a story. Anyway, I, for one thing, that was not a commercial break. That was actually a -- that was an interview. She was being interviewed. She was looking at something. It was an interview that was going to be used for something and it wasn't used.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Like someone came to interview her on the ABC --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- set, and that's probably now it leaked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right. That's why she was looking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It didn't come from ABC; it came from that outside source.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. That's my guess. I'm just saying that. That's not --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. It didn't come from ABC. They wouldn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But here's my big point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right. But Dana, it will gauge in it --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This is why I hate royalty. OK?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They didn't want to do the investigation because they didn't want to lose on their royalty coverage. Because if they talked about Prince, what's his face?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Andrew.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They will get -- Prince Andrew. So, this is -- the public doesn't understand how stories get chosen sometimes. Idiotic reasons cause people to make decisions.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like we better not upset the royalty so we don't get the royalty coverage of the little baby. That's why they didn't cover it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: OK. I want to Jesse. I want to talk to Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was a great point, judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: It was a great point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You should tell me it was a great point.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Let me tell you, it's a great point. Now, at what she says, after the fact she says and I think you are the perfect person for this, Jesse. She says, then he absolutely was killed, Jeffrey Epstein.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I heard that somewhere last week, I don't remember. Yes. She got run and Farrow-ed. And they tried to make her put out a statement. It's a weak disgraceful statement, but she's not going to die on this hill, she wants to be a company woman. I understand that. But if you look at the - from an outside perspective, if this was Fox News on a hot mic, killing a story about Epstein with the Donald Trump connection, I think this place would be out of business. And ABC obviously was trying to preserve access to not only the royal family but to Hillary and because Hillary was going to be the next president of the United States. So that's what this is about. And when you think, do these mainstream networks, did they care about women. And you look back at - you look back at Weinstein, you look back at Anita Roddick (ph). Do they care about children, will they care a lot about children in cages, what about children in America getting raped over and over and over again? And what editorial standards is ABC have. I mean they went after Kavanaugh on a 40-year-old allegation over nothing. In this case, witnesses, documents, photographs.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I wasn't involved in it, but yes, we should probably impeach him anyway. All right. I'm going to give you 15 seconds on this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Thanks. That's typical.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what, I think, first of all I'd say this, anything involving Project Veritas. I'd like to see the full transcript. I mean they have a question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You just saw what she said.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no. Right. But we don't know if that's the whole thing. We don't know it is edited, so I don't know. Let me make my point, Judge. Having said that the reporter never said that what we saw was wrong. So, I'm going to take it for granted that you know what she just gave the green light. And she's saying though that she never stopped work. They said they're going to air something--

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Baloney.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Can I finish--

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They're not doing anything until next year.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Do you mind?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK, thanks. I understand.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Because I gave you the 15 seconds.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I understand. But anyway, she says they're going to have a show next year on this. But here's the point, just like Ronan Farrow what it looks like is that they sat on a story that should have run at that time.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, they sat on it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Here's my thing though. I was once a reporter who was hungry for the front page in every case and I would have shouting matches with editors and lawyers who would say Juan we've got to confirm this. You're going to get us sued. Juan, stop. OK, so I understand that editors and lawyers are all part of this deal. That's politics.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But you know what, it wasn't a deal with the National Enquirer. We know that get something--

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: That's not what it's about. Brian Kilmeade is crashing the set, find out why. Here he comes, Brian Kilmeade out of the dawn.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We have a very special guest right now, Brian Kilmeade joins us to talk about his new book Sam Houston and the Alamo Avengers, which is out today. I'm even holding it up so nicely for everyone to see, but they already have a cover shot. OK, Brian.

utterances.speaker: BRIAN KILMEADE, HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is your fourth?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Sixth overall, fourth history book.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And there it was a lot that happened before the Alamo. Do you know who told me that, Joe Ricketts because he loves your book and he has been reading it and he says, it's very good.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And we both have the same bank accounts. I mean Joe Ricketts, we both - I had Ameritrade First since you really need the money, you can keep it. But no, that's very nice. And you're going to be hosting me at the Bush Library.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I am.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: And you actually read the book.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I am reading the book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, can I ask a question of everybody here at this table who showed up to your book party last night?

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: It was Jesse Watters. But it's tough on Monday nights.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But who is going to all the way to Dallas.

utterances.speaker: KILMEADE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, fine. I want to ask you a question because I noticed this at the book thing last night. You're saying, it's the Alamo Avengers, it's not revenge, it's avenge. Why is that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: When was that? I missed that, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was the night of the election.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I missed that.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I missed it. The night of the election.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Two years, three years your fears.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You created the resistance.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That fix your narrative but that is not true. Hillary Clinton conceded the election. And remember --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Not that night.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hang on. Remember it's Donald Trump who said I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let me get the capsule.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, but he did. He conceded --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also, judge, you got put it in this way or none of the things are going to fit. That's better. Now everything can fit.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was told to do that by the way. I did not think of that myself. I'm going to put in the capsule the polls as of right now that show Donald Trump losing to Warren, to Bernie Sanders and to Joe Biden by 15 points. OK?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I just want to remind everybody the same poll a year out before last election had Hillary Clinton beating Donald Trump by 12 points. So, when I open the capsule next election, after a year, I don't think Donald Trump will have lost to any of these people by 15 points. And that's why I will be stuffing this thing in like so there, because I know Juan likes to cite polls and that will be one poll that be citing. This would be a message in a bottle. And the message will be that you were wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Dana?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: All right. But you said like I could have a couple of things?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. So, I'm not breaking the rules here. First of all, there's going to be a lot of political ads, like a lot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, I got earplugs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Very good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: In case you want some earplugs.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And the CVS brand. You didn't want to splurge --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And they're orange.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I have also probably the best predictor of the polls. But it's today's stock market.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Highest, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know yesterday was. I don't know about today.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And then today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think today is the highest, It's a new high.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I missed the top of Cavuto. Sorry. Dow Jones, NASDAQ and S&P 500 records. OK. So, I'm going to put this in a capsule because that is a good predictor of what's going to happen next year. And then the one I'm really proud of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That the young people didn't even know. Smelling salts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: For the people who are going to faint --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Whatever the results are.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is so true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, there did you find these?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, the thing is, they don't really sell smelling salts anymore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, these are bath salts.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: These are, you know, these are illegal smelling salts. You got these on the streets.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Why don't they sell them?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, she got them from Thursday night football. I think (Inaudible) had some in the green room.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Why don't they sell them anymore?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Something -- I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You can make drugs of them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Or something.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The old met thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you get the point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I get the point. Now this is great.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's good. I am adding a mouth guard because it might be the only thing left after 2020. You know, it's going to be a fight.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Gosh. So, you're not going to put that in there now?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You just contaminated the capsule, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And it taste funny.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You never wore a mouthpiece before, did you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: let's wash it before we put --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: When I played pop warner football or whatever. But yes, this is - -

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Danny, come get it and clean it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. We'll need a new one. This one will be used for some kind of criminal investigation.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Where is this going to be until next year?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Where are we going to put the time capsule?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What? Good question?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Where is that going to be?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, we're going to put it in a place where no one ever goes to. The Fox News gym. I kid. But it will be played in a locker at the Fox News gym --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- with its own --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Personal trainer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Personal trainer. And then we'll open it. Now the question is, do we open it? My God. The night of the -- do we wait Tuesday or do we wait until Wednesday?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think after. Yes, Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wednesday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. That's what we will do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That will be -- I mean, everyone set their DVRs a year from now.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So, we all have to be on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, we all have to be on. That will be funny thing like if some of us aren't here anymore.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do we want to take (Inaudible) not any place and he bets on who might not be here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: But did you put the mouth guard in? Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I didn't put the mouth guard in, you're telling me not to because you want put in a new one because I put it in my mouth.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Put it in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Groovy. Well, that was fun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Here we go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There we go.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: yes, but I need my gavel for my office.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You are not getting the gavel.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You'll get it in a year.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We'll get you another gavel.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes? Like that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's leucite, Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't get a leucite gavel just anywhere.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We'll get her a wooden one.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I had one and I broke it when I was on the bench.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right? You just whacked it. You get it broken on some guy's head.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: They were too far from me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. I guess, am I teasing now? Up next, nine Americans including women and children were gunned down by a drug cartel in Mexico. The latest ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Now a disturbing story that we've been following. A massacre south of the border. At least nine Americans are dead including six children. The family was travelling in three separate SUVs when they were brutally ambushed by a drug cartel gunman. One family member sharing this gut-wrenching video of a burnt-out car where some of the victims were discovered.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This is for the record. Nita and four of my grandchildren are burned and shot up.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's still not clear what exactly happened. The FBI is investigating and Mexican authorities say the family may have been mistaken for a rival gang. The president, however, demanding action, tweeting, "This is the time for Mexico with the help of the United States to wage war on the drug cartels and wipe them off the face of the earth. We merely await a call from your great new president." Jesse, you know, it seems to me, we are still trying to get our minds around this, it's a terrible tragedy. Children dying, mothers dying.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But it's a manifestation of the kind of drug violence that we've seen, not only in Mexico. We've seen here in the United States, it's even worse in places like El Salvador, Colombia. And I suspect this is why people flee. What do you think is the appropriate response?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, people flee not just for drug violence but also to get money working in America. I think it's a dangerous country. And outside the resorts, I mean, this could happen anywhere. It's not a safe place to be. Our neighbors to the south are corrupt. The cartels run this government. El Chapo is worth a billion dollars before he got pinched. They tell the Mexican government officials what to do. Many of them are on the take. They can't control the cartels. Most of the times they don't want to. They're just dancing with the devils. It's kind of an arranged marriage. And this country loves our drugs and we like them cheap. So, we are fighting this war on drugs. It's the longest war America has ever fought. I don't see an end game. But right now, the cartels made a very, very big mistake. Because Donald Trump is going to want justice, he's going to want vengeance and he has been looking for an opportunity to squeeze the Mexican government on the border. It's good politics to go after the cartels, it's good policies to go after the cartels. And watch, he'll do that and you'll see the media and the Democrats start defending drug cartels. I guarantee it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wow. I don't know about that one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No. You don't remember he said MS-13 are animals and Nancy defended them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: yes, it was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Judge, Mexico rejected the president's offer to send in some military-type help.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And the argument is well, you know, after the El Paso white supremacist shooting Mexico is saying we are going to send Mexican troops to El Paso. What do you think about the fact that they are saying no?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, I'm glad you brought it up. Because in response to what the president said it's time for Mexico with the help of the United States to go after these cartels and wage war. The new president of Mexico says, quote, "The worst thing you can have is war. We declared war and it didn't work. That is not an option." Well, if war against the cartel, a drug cartel that's killing women, children, babies, burning, shooting. Kidnapping them. It's not justified, then you know what. I don't know. Then the president, as far as I'm concerned has the right to do whatever it is he needs to do to go in there and protect American citizens who are there. Now there apparently is an area in that Sonora and Chihuahua area where Americans have bene living safely for many, many years. They are about 70 miles from the Arizona border. So, I suspect they feel a certain comfort level there. Although in researching the issue of the danger level, Mexico as a country is a level two danger zone.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Those particular counties, Sonora and Chihuahua are level three. Advanced warning because the Sinaloa cartel is doing business there. So, you got a combination of people having to worry about what is going on in their neighborhood and a combination of, you know, Americans saying it's not a safe place to be. So, what do you do? You go in there and you send in military as far as I'm concerned in a situation like that. If they are doing this to American citizens. It's not enough. Because if the president is saying we can't wage war, it's not an option, what does he want to do? Have diplomacy? Meet them at the table? These people will cut your - limbs off because this is how they make their money.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. So, Dana, you know, I just want to express the hope that, you know, people don't, especially President Trump doesn't use this to exploit the tragedy to somehow attack Mexicans or for the wall.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan -- Juan, Americans were just slaughtered, babies were burned alive --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I'm talking --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- and you are saying Trump is going to exploit it?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Excuse me. You just talked about the politics. In fact, you said you don't think that this is the war on drugs as really been a success --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, I think it's a little too soon for all of that right now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I think the point -

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, my point to Dana was --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think anybody is exploiting anybody --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- except that the cartels are exploiting innocent people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is a big story because they are Americans and it's a big story here. But let's just -- let me mention to you. In 2018, homicides linked to drug cartels 36,000 people in 2018. In 2019, 90 murders a day. So not there is a question as to whether this was actually mistaken identity.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Our State Department through anonymous source basically said they don't think that's the case. And so, now Mexico has a war on its hands whether they like or not. The president of the United States is saying I will help you. And I don't think the Mexican government has enough confidence, as Jesse was saying, they're basically, you know, the slaves too, the cartel. I am a big proponent of solving problems at their source. The question is what is the source? Si it the supply or the demand? And do we do something on the demand side here? Like it's like legalization? I don't know. That's got to be determined by smarter people. But I also think there is one other policy recommendation that the president could do. And that is designating the cartels as a terrorist organization and then that changes everything legally --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: the banking.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- and what you can do. And basically you can then say you are either with us or you're against us and you have more tools to fight.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think they already go after the money for the drug cartels.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, they've tried.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But if you designate them as a terrorist organization.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes. Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'll be fast. To your point, this is how they make their money. They make their money because it's an illegal industry. I would rather end the drug war than fight a drug war because we haven't -- we can't win a war. So, ultimately, at some point, we're going to have to decriminalize drugs in the United States which will handle -- which will handle the demand question so that it doesn't end up on the streets. We know that there is a down side to that. You will see junkies as we have seen in our own neighborhoods.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's surrender.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's not.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's surrender.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Hey, everybody has a right to their oblivion. And we know for one thing that people are still going to chase their right to oblivion no matter how dangerous or risky it is. You got to -- in order to change or cut throat business you got to turn it into a business.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wow. That's really an interesting discussion. An ABC anchor admitting her network stopped a bombshell story about Jeffrey Epstein. We're going to show you the tape next right here on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: An ABC News anchor caught on a hot mic saying the network spiked an explosive story about Jeffrey Epstein three years ago. Project veritas has released the video. Now Fox News has not been able to independently verify it. But here it is.

utterances.speaker: AMY ROBACH, ANCHOR, ABC NEWS
utterances.utterance: I've had a story for three years. I've had this interview with Virginia Roberts. We would not put it on the air. First of all, I was told, who's Jeffrey Epstein? No one knows who that is. This is a stupid story. Then the Palace found out that we had her whole allegations about Prince Andrew and threatened us in a million different ways. We were so afraid we wouldn't be able to interview Kate and Will, that we -- that also squashed the story. She told me everything. She had pictures. She was in hiding for 12 years. We convinced her to come out. We convinced her to talk to us. It was unbelievable what we had Clinton. We had everything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That is something.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Amy Robach now claims she was caught in a moment of frustration and the interview wasn't ready for air. And ABC is downplaying video, saying, quote, "At the time, not all of our reporting met our standards to air, but we have never stop investigating the story." Dana? You're the real journalist here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, I don't know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, Amy Robach, a terrific reporter. She recently landed the Hunter Biden interview in which she put him through his paces there. When I first heard this, I thought, this can happen. Right. So we all have commercial breaks. Many a day.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And you think, somebody could actually take the video of what you are saying during commercial break which is like a commercial break chitchat and then -- and then leak it. I find the walk back a little hard to believe. And I think that the defense from ABC I think they got caught flat footed. I wouldn't be to be their P.R. department there today because a P.R. department isn't the one that made the call. It sounds like there's something happened. And again, it just adds to the additional mystery about what happened with Jeffrey Epstein. How people covered it up for years and now even in his death there are questions.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You know, the amazing thing about it, Greg, you had NBC who, you know, through Ronan Farrow said this thing is already there. Now we found out that ABC is doing the same kind of thing. And you know, she, her frustration is evidenced by the fact that she says we had everything. I tried for three years to get it on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The woman was quiet. Virginia Roberts, Giuffre Roberts, whatever the name is, was quiet for 12 years. I get her to talk and they don't want to play it. What is ABC's connection?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is amazing how many people Hillary Clinton can kill over a story. Anyway, I, for one thing, that was not a commercial break. That was actually a -- that was an interview. She was being interviewed. She was looking at something. It was an interview that was going to be used for something and it wasn't used.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Like someone came to interview her on the ABC --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- set, and that's probably now it leaked.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. That's why she was looking.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It didn't come from ABC; it came from that outside source.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's my guess. I'm just saying that. That's not --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. It didn't come from ABC. They wouldn't --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But here's my big point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. But Dana, it will gauge in it --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is why I hate royalty. OK?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They didn't want to do the investigation because they didn't want to lose on their royalty coverage. Because if they talked about Prince, what's his face?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Andrew.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They will get -- Prince Andrew. So, this is -- the public doesn't understand how stories get chosen sometimes. Idiotic reasons cause people to make decisions.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like we better not upset the royalty so we don't get the royalty coverage of the little baby. That's why they didn't cover it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK. I want to Jesse. I want to talk to Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was a great point, judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It was a great point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You should tell me it was a great point.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Let me tell you, it's a great point. Now, at what she says, after the fact she says and I think you are the perfect person for this, Jesse. She says, then he absolutely was killed, Jeffrey Epstein.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I heard that somewhere last week, I don't remember. Yes. She got run and Farrow-ed. And they tried to make her put out a statement. It's a weak disgraceful statement, but she's not going to die on this hill, she wants to be a company woman. I understand that. But if you look at the - from an outside perspective, if this was Fox News on a hot mic, killing a story about Epstein with the Donald Trump connection, I think this place would be out of business. And ABC obviously was trying to preserve access to not only the royal family but to Hillary and because Hillary was going to be the next president of the United States. So that's what this is about. And when you think, do these mainstream networks, did they care about women. And you look back at - you look back at Weinstein, you look back at Anita Roddick (ph). Do they care about children, will they care a lot about children in cages, what about children in America getting raped over and over and over again? And what editorial standards is ABC have. I mean they went after Kavanaugh on a 40-year-old allegation over nothing. In this case, witnesses, documents, photographs.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I wasn't involved in it, but yes, we should probably impeach him anyway. All right. I'm going to give you 15 seconds on this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thanks. That's typical.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what, I think, first of all I'd say this, anything involving Project Veritas. I'd like to see the full transcript. I mean they have a question.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You just saw what she said.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no. Right. But we don't know if that's the whole thing. We don't know it is edited, so I don't know. Let me make my point, Judge. Having said that the reporter never said that what we saw was wrong. So, I'm going to take it for granted that you know what she just gave the green light. And she's saying though that she never stopped work. They said they're going to air something--

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
